pageContext.claim: “Mexico is doing NOTHING to help stop the flow of illegal immigrants to our Country. They are all talk and no action. Likewise, Honduras, Guatemala and El Salvador have taken our money for years, and do Nothing. The Dems don't care, such BAD laws. May close the Southern Border!”
pageContext.analysis: Trump is mixing up undocumented immigrants and migrants seeking asylum. There are relatively few Mexicans illegally crossing into the United States now, and the Mexican government has taken steps to limit the flow of migrants from central America, such as offering job opportunities in Mexico. Countries do not select individuals for migration or immigration. Instead, people on their own make the decision to flee poverty or violence in search of a better life. Trump appears to contradict an announcement on the same day of this tweet by Homeland Security Secretary Kirstjen M. Nielsen that she had signed a "historic Memorandum of Cooperation (MOC) on border security cooperation in Central America." In her own tweet just six hours after Trump's tweet, she said: "I would like to extend my profound gratitude to our Central American allies Honduras, Guatemala & El Salvador—as well as @usembassyhn and @USAmbHonduras—for their commitment to our common cause of secure borders & more orderly migration flows."
